Developer Terms of Use
des:
Bamboo English offers thousands of English Language Arts (ELA) exercises in the form of word games for children age 5 to 11, covering five core ELA modules (Vocabulary, Grammar, Spelling, Phonics, & Listening/Reading). 
---
MULTI-USER SUPPORT: Families can set up accounts for up to 6 different users, so each child can learn at their own pace.

Content available includes free access to Unit 1 of 6 for each ELA module, for each grade from Kindergarten through 5th Grade. The paid subscription (which starts with a 14-day free trial) includes all six units (Unit 1 through Unit 6) for each ELA module, for each grade from K–5. Modules include basic, grade level, and "reach" exercises so children can move at their own pace through the ELA curriculum. Content includes lessons and exercises from leading content providers.
---
IS BAMBOO ENGLISH FREE?
Yes! Anyone can use Bamboo English exercises at no cost. We offer a subscription to gain access to all 6 of 6 Units for each of 5 ELA modules, for each grade – K–5.
---
MORE INFO ON BAMBOO ENGLISH
• Phonics exercise examples: “Which word rhymes with BOUNCE – ANNOUNCE or BEHIND?”; “She took the crown into town. Which words rhyme?”
• Spelling exercise examples: “In the word CAT, is the last letter T?”; “In the word FISH, take out F and put in D. What word do you get?” 
• Grammar exercise examples: “We hiked up the mountain. Which word is a verb?”; “What is the antonym of TOGETHER – UNIFIED or DIVIDED?” 
• Vocabulary exercise examples: “What does the word ANTICIPATION mean? A) Looking forward to something, or B) Ability to move objects with the mind.”; “If you add the letters -ER at the end of the word PAINT, what word do you get?”

Bamboo English includes dozens of books leveled for each grade, both for fun, and for children to practice listening and reading comprehension. Examples include:

• Fairy Tales such as: The Hare and the Tortoise and The Emperor's New Clothes
• Short Stories such as: Little Red Riding Hood, Cinderella, and The Elephant’s Child
• Selections from longer works such as: Aladdin, Peter Pan, and Wonderful Wizard of Oz
• Highlights Readers such as: The Lucky Penny, The Skeleton Crew, and Balto The Sled Dog

For children using Alexa screen-based devices like Fire tablets and Fire TV, Bamboo Books offers text and images to permit reading and following along with Alexa.

Note: To make things easier for children to understand, we refer to each grade level as climbing one of the following trees (K – Banana Tree, 1 – Coconut Tree, 2 – Apple Tree, 3 – Oak Tree, 4 – Pine Tree, 5 – Lemon Tree). Additionally, we refer to each “Unit” as climbing a ladder. So, a child working on the 3rd Unit of 2nd grade for Spelling, would be on “Ladder 3 on the Apple Tree in Spelling”. Similarly, a child working on the 6th Unit of 4th grade for Vocabulary, would be on “Ladder 6 on the Pine Tree in Vocabulary.” If they complete this ladder, they would move to “Ladder 1 on the Lemon Tree in Vocabulary” (i.e. 5th Grade, Unit 1).
